comprehensive_overview: Meep (or MIT Electromagnetic Equation Propagation) is a free finite-difference time-domain (FDTD) simulation software package developed at MIT to model electromagnetic systems.
core_features: Some core features of Meep include simulating electromagnetic fields in periodic and non-periodic environments, calculating transmission and reflection of structures, supporting various boundary conditions such as PML (perfectly matched layers), and analyzing photonic crystals and waveguides.
